data.description:
In all new immersive 360° episodes, embrace the people working with the United Nations to secure the future of our planet. Discover how communities in Fiji and Colombia are coming together to build resilience and safeguard future generations.

—

UploadVR: “Get ready for a VR safari”
Webby Nominee for Best VR Video
Best 360° Storytelling in Jackson Wild 2020

‘ecosphere’ is an award winning social impact documentary platform created by PHORIA.

Venture into the wildest places on earth, where indigenous and community-led efforts are creating space for humanity and wildlife to thrive together.

Season 1: Produced in partnership with WWF, Silverback Films Ltd and Meta.
- Kenya
- Borneo
- Raja Ampat

Season 2: Produced in partnership with United Nations DPPA, Media Farm Studios and Meta.
- Sea of Islands
- Pathways Colombia
- Musalem (Coming Soon)

changelog.change_log:
2 New Locations
4 New 360° Episodes
4 New 2D Featurettes
Fixed issue with globe markers not appearing
Fixed issue with episode selection UI not appearing
Various visual, audio, and control improvements

We’re excited to share what we’re doing with the ecosphere app, both in this update, and our vision long term. These updates will allow us to extend the current episodes with the new Journeys content. This means the new Journeys DLC will be available for each location. Now you can take a deeper dive into Kenya, Borneo and Raja Ampat, as seen on Oculus TV.
Major improvements to video compression and quality. Episodes must be re-downloaded to update.
+DLC Update - Final video + Oculus utilities update
+DLC Update - video content only - Launch release
+Turned off skybox fader for performance +Reset FPS to 72 on return to menu + Updated to 64 bit architecture

+ Added exit button on back press in home state + permissions check gives exit button on start state + switched to scene loading between sections for memory management + Texture switch on right controller + Added confirm delete function
